hume
Class Matching

java.lang.Object
  hume.Matching
Direct Known Subclasses:
DoubleSidedMatching, MatrixMatching, SingleSidedMatching
public abstract class Matching
extends java.lang.Object

Class Matching is an abstract class that encapsulates the matching algorithm. To implement a matching algorithm a descendent of this class should be defined that implements the abstract method matchAgents.

Method match Agents is the only method that needs to be overridden, in order to implement a matching algorithm. All other methods in this class are protected methods that implement certain useful utility functions, such as picking a sample from a set of agents. STATUS: fairly mature and well tested

Author:
eckhart

protected static final Agent[] sampleAgents(int n,

Randomly picks n agents from an array of Agents

Parameters:
n - the number of agents to sample
agentList - the array of agents from which the sample shall be taken
Returns:
an array of n samples

pickSample

protected static final Agent[] pickSample(Agent agent,
                                          double sampleSize,
                                          Agent[] referenceGroup)
Returns a sample of agents the size of which is a certain fraction of the reference group. The returned sample does never include the given agent (for which the sample is taken).

Parameters:
sampleSize - the relative size of the sample (ranging from 0.0 to 1.0)
referenceGroup - the group of agents from which the sample shall be taken
Returns:
an array of agents that represents the sample

estimateService

protected double estimateService(Agent agent,
                                 Agent[] sample,
                                 TrustGame game,
                                 double discount)
Estimates the revenue an agent receives if it lets another agent solve its problem (instead of solving it by itself).

Parameters:
agent - the agent for which the revenue shall be estimated
sample - the sample of agents which shall be used for estimation
game - the game to be played between the agent an a potential solution provider.
discount - a discount value rangeing from 0.0 to 1.0 that specifies where the actual estiamted value shall be chosen in the interval from the mean eastimated value (discount = 0.0) and the maximum estimated value (discount = 1.0)
Returns:
the revenue from getting an external solution

matchAgents

public abstract Agent[][] matchAgents(Network network,
                                      TrustGame game)
Assigns problems to the agents and then finds for every agent that has a problem an agent that solves the problem. Some agents may be assigned to themselves as problem solvers.

The method returns an array of pairs ("matches") of agents. Every agent that has a problem will occur in the first place of exactly one of these pairs. Agents that are matched to solve their own problem will occur in both places of one pair. No agent will occur more than once in the second place of a pair, i.e. no agent solves two problems in one round. Agents that do neither have a problem nor solve a problem do not appear in the return value

Parameters:
network - the interaction network that contains the agents that shall be matched. Not all agents need to have a problem, but all agents are considered potential problem solvers.
game - that the problem-agent and its solver play.
Returns:
an array of pairs of agents that have been matched. Depending on how many problems occured (which may be smaller than the number of agents), not all agents may occur in the return value.
